body.p:
The STS 2000A is designed for mission-critical environments and has security features appropriate to that environment:
The administrator assigns each user a unique Personal Identification Number (PIN) associated with an access level, such as administrator or operator, determining what actions the user can perform.
A PIN and password are required to login.
No changes to system parameters or STS operation can be made through the touchscreen Monitor without a valid user login, and no changes at all can be made remotely via web access.
Only one user can be logged in at a time. The Event Log records and time-stamps the user’s login, changes to parameters or actions while the user is logged in, and the user’s logout.
Doors require a key to be opened, controlling access to the MCCBs/MCSWs, ROI, and components.
When an STS font door is opened, the unit alarms and the alarm is logged into the Event Log.
